segment.source: AppLocker (Windows 10)
segment.target: AppLocker (Windows 10)

segment.source: This topic provides a description of AppLocker and can help you decide if your organization can benefit from deploying AppLocker application control policies.
segment.target: This topic provides a description of AppLocker and can help you decide if your organization can benefit from deploying AppLocker application control policies.

segment.source: AppLocker
segment.target: AppLocker

segment.source: Applies to
segment.target: Applies to

segment.source: Windows 10
segment.target: Windows 10

segment.source: This topic provides a description of AppLocker and can help you decide if your organization can benefit from deploying AppLocker application control policies.
segment.target: This topic provides a description of AppLocker and can help you decide if your organization can benefit from deploying AppLocker application control policies.

segment.source: AppLocker helps you control which apps and files users can run.
segment.target: AppLocker helps you control which apps and files users can run.

segment.source: These include executable files, scripts, Windows Installer files, dynamic-link libraries (DLLs), packaged apps, and packaged app installers.
segment.target: These include executable files, scripts, Windows Installer files, dynamic-link libraries (DLLs), packaged apps, and packaged app installers.

segment.source: AppLocker can help you:
segment.target: AppLocker can help you:

segment.source: Define rules based on file attributes that persist across app updates, such as the publisher name (derived from the digital signature), product name, file name, and file version.
segment.target: Define rules based on file attributes that persist across app updates, such as the publisher name (derived from the digital signature), product name, file name, and file version.

segment.source: You can also create rules based on the file path and hash.
segment.target: You can also create rules based on the file path and hash.

segment.source: Assign a rule to a security group or an individual user.
segment.target: Assign a rule to a security group or an individual user.

segment.source: Create exceptions to rules.
segment.target: Create exceptions to rules.

segment.source: For example, you can create a rule that allows all users to run all Windows binaries, except the Registry Editor (regedit.exe).
segment.target: For example, you can create a rule that allows all users to run all Windows binaries, except the Registry Editor (regedit.exe).

segment.source: Use audit-only mode to deploy the policy and understand its impact before enforcing it.
segment.target: Use audit-only mode to deploy the policy and understand its impact before enforcing it.

segment.source: Create rules on a staging server, test them, then export them to your production environment and import them into a Group Policy Object.
segment.target: Create rules on a staging server, test them, then export them to your production environment and import them into a Group Policy Object.

segment.source: Simplify creating and managing AppLocker rules by using Windows PowerShell.
segment.target: Simplify creating and managing AppLocker rules by using Windows PowerShell.

segment.source: AppLocker helps reduce administrative overhead and helps reduce the organization's cost of managing computing resources by decreasing the number of Help Desk calls that result from users running unapproved apps.
segment.target: AppLocker helps reduce administrative overhead and helps reduce the organization's cost of managing computing resources by decreasing the number of Help Desk calls that result from users running unapproved apps.

segment.source: AppLocker addresses the following app security scenarios:
segment.target: AppLocker addresses the following app security scenarios:

segment.source: Application inventory
segment.target: Application inventory

segment.source: AppLocker has the ability to enforce its policy in an audit-only mode where all app access activity is registered in event logs.
segment.target: AppLocker has the ability to enforce its policy in an audit-only mode where all app access activity is registered in event logs.

segment.source: These events can be collected for further analysis.
segment.target: These events can be collected for further analysis.

segment.source: Windows PowerShell cmdlets also help you analyze this data programmatically.
segment.target: Windows PowerShell cmdlets also help you analyze this data programmatically.

segment.source: Protection against unwanted software
segment.target: Protection against unwanted software

segment.source: AppLocker has the ability to deny apps from running when you exclude them from the list of allowed apps.
segment.target: AppLocker has the ability to deny apps from running when you exclude them from the list of allowed apps.

segment.source: When AppLocker rules are enforced in the production environment, any apps that are not included in the allowed rules are blocked from running.
segment.target: When AppLocker rules are enforced in the production environment, any apps that are not included in the allowed rules are blocked from running.

segment.source: Licensing conformance
segment.target: Licensing conformance

segment.source: AppLocker can help you create rules that preclude unlicensed software from running and restrict licensed software to authorized users.
segment.target: AppLocker can help you create rules that preclude unlicensed software from running and restrict licensed software to authorized users.

segment.source: Software standardization
segment.target: Software standardization

segment.source: AppLocker policies can be configured to allow only supported or approved apps to run on computers within a business group.
segment.target: AppLocker policies can be configured to allow only supported or approved apps to run on computers within a business group.

segment.source: This permits a more uniform app deployment.
segment.target: This permits a more uniform app deployment.

segment.source: Manageability improvement
segment.target: Manageability improvement

segment.source: AppLocker includes a number of improvements in manageability as compared to its predecessor Software Restriction Policies.
segment.target: AppLocker includes a number of improvements in manageability as compared to its predecessor Software Restriction Policies.

segment.source: Importing and exporting policies, automatic generation of rules from multiple files, audit-only mode deployment, and Windows PowerShell cmdlets are a few of the improvements over Software Restriction Policies.
segment.target: Importing and exporting policies, automatic generation of rules from multiple files, audit-only mode deployment, and Windows PowerShell cmdlets are a few of the improvements over Software Restriction Policies.

segment.source: New and changed functionality
segment.target: New and changed functionality

segment.source: To find out what's new in AppLocker for Windows 10, see What's new in AppLocker?
segment.target: To find out what's new in AppLocker for Windows 10, see What's new in AppLocker?

segment.source: When to use AppLocker
segment.target: When to use AppLocker

segment.source: In many organizations, information is the most valuable asset, and ensuring that only approved users have access to that information is imperative.
segment.target: In many organizations, information is the most valuable asset, and ensuring that only approved users have access to that information is imperative.

segment.source: Access control technologies, such as Active Directory Rights Management Services (AD RMS) and access control lists (ACLs), help control what users are allowed to access.
segment.target: Access control technologies, such as Active Directory Rights Management Services (AD RMS) and access control lists (ACLs), help control what users are allowed to access.

segment.source: However, when a user runs a process, that process has the same level of access to data that the user has.
segment.target: However, when a user runs a process, that process has the same level of access to data that the user has.

segment.source: As a result, sensitive information could easily be deleted or transmitted out of the organization if a user knowingly or unknowingly runs malicious software.
segment.target: As a result, sensitive information could easily be deleted or transmitted out of the organization if a user knowingly or unknowingly runs malicious software.

segment.source: AppLocker can help mitigate these types of security breaches by restricting the files that users or groups are allowed to run.
segment.target: AppLocker can help mitigate these types of security breaches by restricting the files that users or groups are allowed to run.

segment.source: Software publishers are beginning to create more apps that can be installed by non-administrative users.
segment.target: Software publishers are beginning to create more apps that can be installed by non-administrative users.

segment.source: This could jeopardize an organization's written security policy and circumvent traditional app control solutions that rely on the inability of users to install apps.
segment.target: This could jeopardize an organization's written security policy and circumvent traditional app control solutions that rely on the inability of users to install apps.

segment.source: By creating an allowed list of approved files and apps, AppLocker helps prevent such per-user apps from running.
segment.target: By creating an allowed list of approved files and apps, AppLocker helps prevent such per-user apps from running.

segment.source: Because AppLocker can control DLLs, it is also useful to control who can install and run ActiveX controls.
segment.target: Because AppLocker can control DLLs, it is also useful to control who can install and run ActiveX controls.

segment.source: AppLocker is ideal for organizations that currently use Group Policy to manage their PCs.
segment.target: AppLocker is ideal for organizations that currently use Group Policy to manage their PCs.

segment.source: The following are examples of scenarios in which AppLocker can be used:
segment.target: The following are examples of scenarios in which AppLocker can be used:

segment.source: Your organization's security policy dictates the use of only licensed software, so you need to prevent users from running unlicensed software and also restrict the use of licensed software to authorized users.
segment.target: Your organization's security policy dictates the use of only licensed software, so you need to prevent users from running unlicensed software and also restrict the use of licensed software to authorized users.

segment.source: An app is no longer supported by your organization, so you need to prevent it from being used by everyone.
segment.target: An app is no longer supported by your organization, so you need to prevent it from being used by everyone.

segment.source: The potential that unwanted software can be introduced in your environment is high, so you need to reduce this threat.
segment.target: The potential that unwanted software can be introduced in your environment is high, so you need to reduce this threat.

segment.source: The license to an app has been revoked or it is expired in your organization, so you need to prevent it from being used by everyone.
segment.target: The license to an app has been revoked or it is expired in your organization, so you need to prevent it from being used by everyone.

segment.source: A new app or a new version of an app is deployed, and you need to prevent users from running the old version.
segment.target: A new app or a new version of an app is deployed, and you need to prevent users from running the old version.

segment.source: Specific software tools are not allowed within the organization, or only specific users should have access to those tools.
segment.target: Specific software tools are not allowed within the organization, or only specific users should have access to those tools.

segment.source: A single user or small group of users needs to use a specific app that is denied for all others.
segment.target: A single user or small group of users needs to use a specific app that is denied for all others.

segment.source: Some computers in your organization are shared by people who have different software usage needs, and you need to protect specific apps.
segment.target: Some computers in your organization are shared by people who have different software usage needs, and you need to protect specific apps.

segment.source: In addition to other measures, you need to control the access to sensitive data through app usage.
segment.target: In addition to other measures, you need to control the access to sensitive data through app usage.

segment.source: AppLocker can help you protect the digital assets within your organization, reduce the threat of malicious software being introduced into your environment, and improve the management of application control and the maintenance of application control policies.
segment.target: AppLocker can help you protect the digital assets within your organization, reduce the threat of malicious software being introduced into your environment, and improve the management of application control and the maintenance of application control policies.

segment.source: System requirements
segment.target: System requirements

segment.source: AppLocker policies can only be configured on and applied to computers that are running on the supported versions and editions of the Windows operating system.
segment.target: AppLocker policies can only be configured on and applied to computers that are running on the supported versions and editions of the Windows operating system.

segment.source: Group Policy is required to distribute Group Policy Objects that contain AppLocker policies.
segment.target: Group Policy is required to distribute Group Policy Objects that contain AppLocker policies.

segment.source: For more info, see Requirements to Use AppLocker.
segment.target: For more info, see Requirements to Use AppLocker.

segment.source: AppLocker rules can be created on domain controllers.
segment.target: AppLocker rules can be created on domain controllers.

segment.source: Installing AppLocker
segment.target: Installing AppLocker

segment.source: AppLocker is included with enterprise-level editions of Windows.
segment.target: AppLocker is included with enterprise-level editions of Windows.

segment.source: You can author AppLocker rules for a single computer or for a group of computers.
segment.target: You can author AppLocker rules for a single computer or for a group of computers.

segment.source: For a single computer, you can author the rules by using the Local Security Policy editor (secpol.msc).
segment.target: For a single computer, you can author the rules by using the Local Security Policy editor (secpol.msc).

segment.source: For a group of computers, you can author the rules within a Group Policy Object by using the Group Policy Management Console (GPMC).
segment.target: For a group of computers, you can author the rules within a Group Policy Object by using the Group Policy Management Console (GPMC).

segment.source: Note: The GPMC is available in client computers running Windows only by installing the Remote Server Administration Tools.
segment.target: Note: The GPMC is available in client computers running Windows only by installing the Remote Server Administration Tools.

segment.source: On computer running Windows Server, you must install the Group Policy Management feature.
segment.target: On computer running Windows Server, you must install the Group Policy Management feature.

segment.source: Using AppLocker on Server Core
segment.target: Using AppLocker on Server Core

segment.source: AppLocker on Server Core installations is not supported.
segment.target: AppLocker on Server Core installations is not supported.

segment.source: Virtualization considerations
segment.target: Virtualization considerations

segment.source: You can administer AppLocker policies by using a virtualized instance of Windows provided it meets all the system requirements listed previously.
segment.target: You can administer AppLocker policies by using a virtualized instance of Windows provided it meets all the system requirements listed previously.

segment.source: You can also run Group Policy in a virtualized instance.
segment.target: You can also run Group Policy in a virtualized instance.

segment.source: However, you do risk losing the policies that you created and maintain if the virtualized instance is removed or fails.
segment.target: However, you do risk losing the policies that you created and maintain if the virtualized instance is removed or fails.

segment.source: Security considerations
segment.target: Security considerations

segment.source: Application control policies specify which apps are allowed to run on the local computer.
segment.target: Application control policies specify which apps are allowed to run on the local computer.

segment.source: The variety of forms that malicious software can take make it difficult for users to know what is safe to run.
segment.target: The variety of forms that malicious software can take make it difficult for users to know what is safe to run.

segment.source: When activated, malicious software can damage content on a hard disk drive, flood a network with requests to cause a denial-of-service (DoS) attack, send confidential information to the Internet, or compromise the security of a computer.
segment.target: When activated, malicious software can damage content on a hard disk drive, flood a network with requests to cause a denial-of-service (DoS) attack, send confidential information to the Internet, or compromise the security of a computer.

segment.source: The countermeasure is to create a sound design for your application control policies on PCs in your organization, and then thoroughly test the policies in a lab environment before you deploy them in a production environment.
segment.target: The countermeasure is to create a sound design for your application control policies on PCs in your organization, and then thoroughly test the policies in a lab environment before you deploy them in a production environment.

segment.source: AppLocker can be part of your app control strategy because you can control what software is allowed to run on your computers.
segment.target: AppLocker can be part of your app control strategy because you can control what software is allowed to run on your computers.

segment.source: A flawed application control policy implementation can disable necessary applications or allow malicious or unintended software to run.
segment.target: A flawed application control policy implementation can disable necessary applications or allow malicious or unintended software to run.

segment.source: Therefore, it is important that organizations dedicate sufficient resources to manage and troubleshoot the implementation of such policies.
segment.target: Therefore, it is important that organizations dedicate sufficient resources to manage and troubleshoot the implementation of such policies.

segment.source: For additional information about specific security issues, see Security considerations for AppLocker.
segment.target: For additional information about specific security issues, see Security considerations for AppLocker.

segment.source: When you use AppLocker to create application control policies, you should be aware of the following security considerations:
segment.target: When you use AppLocker to create application control policies, you should be aware of the following security considerations:

segment.target: Who has the rights to set AppLocker policies?

segment.source: How do you validate that the policies are enforced?
segment.target: How do you validate that the policies are enforced?

segment.source: What events should you audit?
segment.target: What events should you audit?

segment.target: Management interfaces

segment.target: AppLocker can be managed by using a Microsoft Management Console snap-in, Group Policy Management, and Windows PowerShell

segment.source: Minimum privileges required
segment.target: Minimum privileges required

segment.source: Administrator on the local computer; Domain Admin, or any set of rights that allow you to create, edit and distribute Group Policy Objects.
segment.target: Administrator on the local computer; Domain Admin, or any set of rights that allow you to create, edit and distribute Group Policy Objects.

segment.source: Not applicable
segment.target: Not applicable

segment.target: Appidpolicyconverter.exe is put in a scheduled task to be run on demand.

segment.target: Security Policies

segment.source: None required.
segment.target: None required.

segment.source: AppLocker creates security policies.
segment.target: AppLocker creates security policies.

segment.target: System Services required

segment.source: Application Identity service (appidsvc) runs under LocalServiceAndNoImpersonation.
segment.target: Application Identity service (appidsvc) runs under LocalServiceAndNoImpersonation.
